intro: Galium leiocarpum, commonly known as small-fruited bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds, and the plant often grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands or stream banks. Galium leiocarpum is generally low-growing and has a creeping or upright habit depending on the habitat.
